summary: This document is a forwarded email chain from July 2019 discussing investigative tasks for the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force. It includes a request to interview or subpoena publicist R. Couri Hay regarding statements made by Jeffrey Epstein, and a request to set up a meeting with two sisters (one a former Epstein employee) who may have information about coercive sexual encounters involving Epstein and his associates.

persons.name: R. Couri Hay
persons.context: Referenced in New York Times stories as having had a conversation with Jeffrey Epstein about Epstein's prior conduct and his reputation. A subpoena is attached to compel his interview.

persons.name: George
persons.context: Scheduled to conduct an interview with someone named Rachel later in the evening on July 16, 2019.

persons.name: Rachel
persons.context: Scheduled to be interviewed by George on the evening of July 16, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the investigation. The email references his conversation with R. Couri Hay where he discussed his prior conduct and reputation.

connections.description: Had a conversation where Epstein discussed his prior conduct and attempts to improve his reputation. Hay declined to represent him.
George was scheduled to conduct an interview with Rachel.

events.title: Interview Scheduling for R. Couri Hay and Rachel
events.description: NYPD/FBI Task Force members coordinate to have two individuals assist with interviewing R. Couri Hay (using a subpoena if necessary) and for George to interview Rachel.

events.title: Request to Contact Sisters and R. Couri Hay
events.description: An email requests setting up a meeting with two sisters (one a former Epstein employee) who may have useful information and to contact publicist R. Couri Hay regarding his conversation with Epstein.

events.title: Epstein's Conversation with R. Couri Hay
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein had a conversation with publicist R. Couri Hay about improving his reputation, asserting his prior conviction did not constitute pedophilia and that the girls were 'tweens and teens'.

keyFacts: Investigators sought to interview publicist R. Couri Hay because he had a recent conversation with Jeffrey Epstein where Epstein discussed his prior conduct and attempts to manage his reputation.

Investigators planned to meet with two sisters, one of whom previously worked for Epstein, who were not believed to be underage victims but may have been victims of coercive sexual encounters with Epstein and/or his associates.
The document shows active investigative coordination in July 2019 by the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force following new federal charges against Epstein.
A subpoena was prepared for R. Couri Hay, indicating he was not initially willing to be interviewed informally.
The email references New York Times stories that reported on Epstein's conversation with Hay.
